revised_title: Spinning Test-Particles in General Relativity: Equations of Motion and Applications
tldr: This article discusses the equations of motion for spinning test particles in the Schwarzschild field, a solution to Einstein's field equations representing the gravitational field of a massive, non-rotating body. The authors analyze the effects of spin on the motion of test particles and the conservation of energy and angular momentum. They also estimate the influence of spin on planetary motion and the deflection of light rays in a gravitational field.
